meanings.definition: (verb) to form small, tight curls or waves in hair
meanings.sent1: She was frizzing her hair before the party.
meanings.sent2: Her hair started frizzing in the humid weather.
meanings.sent3: The hairdryer went crazy, frizzing her hair in all directions.
meanings.sent4: The wind frizzing the leaves on the trees made them look like dancing fairies.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's hair was frizzing so much, it almost looked like a fluffy cloud.

meanings.sent1: She always struggled with her frizzing hair in the mornings.
meanings.sent2: The frizzing hair made her look like a lioness.
meanings.sent3: His frizzing hair seemed to have a mind of its own, bouncing around.
meanings.sent4: The frizzing hair on the doll gave it a wild and untamed look.
meanings.sent5: The frizzing hair added a unique charm to her overall appearance.

meanings.definition: (noun) the act of creating frizz in hair
meanings.sent1: Her frizzing of the hair was intentional for the retro look.
meanings.sent2: The stylist's frizzing of the model's hair took hours to perfect.
meanings.sent3: The frizzing of her hair was so extreme, it became a fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: The frizzing of the hair in the movie created a sense of chaos in the scene.
meanings.sent5: The frizzing of the hair added a touch of whimsy to her overall style.
